greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of a(n,k) = number of k-member minimal covers of an n-set (n >= k >= 1).
comment: These are what Clarke calls "Minimal disordered k-covers of labeled n-set".
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..75, flattened
R. J. Clarke, Covering a set by subsets, Discrete Math., 81 (1990), 147-152.
T. Hearne and C. G. Wagner, Minimal covers of finite sets, Discr. Math. 5 (1973), 247-251.
A. J. Macula, Lewis Carroll and the enumeration of minimal covers, Math. Mag., 68 (1995), 269-274.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Minimal Cover
maple: seq(seq(a(n, k), k=1..n), n=1..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 02 2013
mathematica: a[n_, k_] := Sum[ (-1)^i*(2^k-i-1)^n / (i!*(k-i)!), {i, 0, k}]; Flatten[ Table[ a[n, k], {n, 1, 9}, {k, 1, n}]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 13 2011, after PARI *)
program: (PARI) {a(n, k) = sum(i=0, k, (-1)^i * binomial(k, i) * (2^k-1-i)^n) / k!} /* _Michael Somos_, Aug 05 1999 */
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
ext: Explicit formulas added by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 05 2011
